lead_paragraph: THE AMERICAS ECUADOR: RANSOM FOR 7 IS PAID -- Employers of seven foreign oil workers, including four Americans, held hostage by an unidentified group in the Amazon have paid a ransom and are awaiting their release, a police spokesman said. The payment, made last week, was estimated at $13 million. Earlier this year a captive American, Ronald Sander, was shot to death when his employers failed to pay a ransom. (Reuters)
